info.description: Use the Oracle Integration Cloud Service REST API to manage and monitor integrations, adapters, connections, lookups, and packages.
info.title: REST API for Oracle Integration Cloud Service, Version 2
info.x-summary: Use the Oracle Integration Cloud Service REST API to manage and monitor integrations, adapters, connections, lookups, and packages.

tags.name: adapters
tags.description: Retrieve a list of adapters or details about a single adapter.

tags.name: integrations
tags.description: Retrieve, delete, export, import, activate, deactivate, and run integrations.

tags.name: lookups
tags.description: Retrieve a list of lookups or details about a single lookup.

tags.name: monitoring
tags.description: Retrieve integration metrics and error instances and view or export the monitoring log.

tags.name: packages
tags.description: Retrieve, delete, export, and import packages.

get.description: Retrieves a list of connections.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters results by name and status.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name, last updated time, or type.

get.description: Retrieves a connection. The response includes only the data visible in the ICS console.

post.description: Updates a connection's security and connection properties (only wsdl, username, and password).

parameters.name: X-HTTP-Method-Override
parameters.description: HTTP Method override in the header

get.description: Retrieves a list of integrations.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters results by name, status, and type.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name or last updated time.

post.description: Imports (adds) an integration that was exported previously. Importing an integration under a different user name or version that was exported is not supported. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

put.description: Imports (replaces) an integration with the same name that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

get.description: Retrieves the current version of an integration by ID.
Retrieves all versions of an integration by ID.
Retrieves a single integration specified by the ID and version.

delete.description: Deletes a single integration specified by the ID and version.

get.description: Exports an integration. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

parameters.name: X-HTTP-Method-Override
parameters.description: HTTP Method override in the header

get.description: Retrieves a list of error instances.
Retrieves an error instance.
Retrieves a list of flow instances.
Retrieves a flow instance.

get.summary: Retrieve Monitoring Metrics for All Integrations
get.description: Retrieves monitoring metrics (statistics) for all integrations.

get.summary: Retrieve Monitoring Metrics for an Integration
get.description: Retrieves monitoring metrics for the current version of an integration.

get.summary: Retrieve Monitoring Metrics for All Integration Versions
get.description: Retrieves monitoring metrics for all versions of an integration.

get.summary: Retrieve Monitoring Metrics for an Integration Version
get.description: Retrieves monitoring metrics for a single version of an integration.
Retrieves a list of monitoring log files.
Retrieves a monitoring log file by ID.
Retrieves a list of lookups.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name or last updated time.

get.description: Retrieves a lookup by ID.
Retrieves a list of adapters.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters results by name and source.

get.description: Retrieves an adapter by name and lists details.
Retrieves a list of packages.

post.description: Imports (adds) a package that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

get.description: Retrieves a package by name.
Exports a package. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.
